{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3151141,"name":"Liam Basilone ","username":"LiamBasilone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/liambasilone/{size}/180362_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-23T14:07:40.467Z","cooked":"

Hey yall, I had a quick question about how to use PathPlanner with a differential drive. I couldn’t find anything that really helped me through the documentation or anything I looked up. if anyone could send me their code of pathplanner with differential drive in java or any documentation that’s better than what is mainstream that would help me a lot.
Thank you so much!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-02-23T14:07:40.467Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":462,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":2332.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":427818,"topic_slug":"help-with-differential-drive-pathplanner","display_username":"Liam Basilone ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55555,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3110 Zip-Tie Enthusiast"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-differential-drive-pathplanner/427818/1","custom_user_title":"3110 Zip-Tie Enthusiast","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3151151,"name":"Josh Weeks","username":"MojoFilter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mojofilter/{size}/182835_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-23T14:25:56.436Z","cooked":"

I think what you’re looking for is the Ramsete controller example at the bottom of the documentation:

GitHub

PathPlannerLib: Java Usage

A simple yet powerful motion profile generator for FRC robots - mjansen4857/pathplanner

We have a simple command that we use to quickly test paths on our differential drive (typically for testing in simulation):

    private Command buildAutoPath(DriveTrain drive, String pathName) {
        Trajectory trajectory = PathPlanner.loadPath(pathName, new PathConstraints(
                Constants.Auto.MaxSpeedMetersPerSecond, Constants.Auto.MaxAccelerationMetersPerSecondSquared));

        RamseteCommand ramseteCommand = new RamseteCommand(
                trajectory,
                drive::getPose,
                new RamseteController(Constants.Auto.RamseteB, Constants.Auto.RamseteZ),
                new SimpleMotorFeedforward(
                        Constants.DriveTrain.StaticGainVolts,
                        Constants.DriveTrain.VelocityGainVolts,
                        Constants.DriveTrain.AccelerationGainVolts),
                Constants.DriveTrain.DriveKinematics,
                drive::getWheelSpeeds,
                new PIDController(Constants.DriveTrain.PDriveVelocity, 0, 0),
                new PIDController(Constants.DriveTrain.PDriveVelocity, 0, 0),
                // RamseteCommand passes volts to the callback
                drive::tankDriveVolts,
                drive);

        // Reset odometry to the starting pose of the trajectory.
        drive.resetOdometry(trajectory.getInitialPose());

        // Run path following command, then stop at the end.
        return ramseteCommand.andThen(() -> drive.tankDriveVolts(0, 0));
    }

I hear that. The gist of it is that it uses the various PID and feedforward settings to smooth out the changes over time and account for error.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Ramsete Controller

The Ramsete Controller is a trajectory tracker that is built in to WPILib. This tracker can be used to accurately track trajectories with correction for minor disturbances. Constructing the Ramsete...

The Ramsete command is like a helpful wrapper around it. You could probably glean a lot from its implementation:

github.com

wpilibsuite/allwpilib/blob/main/wpilibNewCommands/src/main/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj2/command/RamseteCommand.java

// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of
// the WPILib BSD license file in the root directory of this project.

package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command;

import static edu.wpi.first.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;

import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.PIDController;
import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.RamseteController;
import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.SimpleMotorFeedforward;
import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.ChassisSpeeds;
import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.DifferentialDriveKinematics;
import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds;
import edu.wpi.first.math.trajectory.Trajectory;
import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableBuilder;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Timer;
import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
import java.util.function.Supplier;
